Blog 12

Published on May 1, 2020

    Basic Installation of AWS CLI and Configure on MacOs

    Step 1: check if python installed

    python --version

    if not, install Brew, and Python

    Python - xcode-select --install

    Brew - /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com Homebrew/install/master/install.sh)"

    Step 2: Install AWS ClI with Homebrew

    brew install awscli

    check if it installed

    which aws

    Configure AWS Cli

    Step 1: Create Admin user - from Blog 8

    login into Root account and click on IAM roles As you can see in the dashboard the security status, and IAM resources To add a new user click on users then click on add Add user. There are 5 steps to add a new user, in the first step create a name and access type. Create a new group to attach policies for the user, for example, you can create, an Administrator Access Create a new Group name and add policy Add tags to know what user does Review and create You can email login instructions, and donâ€™t forget secret access key otherwise you will never get it again

    Step 2: Now Provide IAM admin user secret key and access key

    aws configure

    Check if aws cli properly configured

    aws sts get-caller-identity
